title: Boris Johnson calls for new ‘Trump deal’ with Iran
text:
Britain's Prime Minister Boris Johnson | Frank Augstein/AFP via Getty Images Boris Johnson calls for new ‘Trump deal’ with Iran Donald Trump welcomed the call for a new Iranian nuclear pact

NEW YORK — Boris Johnson has called for a new “Trump deal” with Iran after attacking the existing nuclear pact.

The U.K. prime minister said the current agreement was a “bad deal” with “many defects” and argued U.S. President Donald Trump was the “one guy” who could renegotiate it.

Johnson made the comments at the U.N. General Assembly amid a ratcheting up of tensions in the Middle East.

Trump put the current Iran nuclear deal at risk when he pulled the U.S. out last year. Other nations have pledged to keep the pact going, but relations have been put under strain.

The issue came to a head earlier this month when Saudi Arabian oil facilities were attacked by drone strikes. The U.S. and U.K. have laid the blame on Tehran.

Speaking to NBC, Johnson said it was difficult to tell whether relations would have been better without the U.S. withdrawal “because the reality is, as President Trump rightly said, it was a bad deal.”

“It had many defects. Iran was and is behaving disruptively in the region,” he added.

“But I think there’s an opportunity now if everyone can de-escalate for us all — that’s to say the Europeans, the U.K., plus the United States and others — to look at a successor to that deal. If it was a bad deal — and I’m willing to accept that it had many, many defects — then let’s do a better deal.”

He went on: “And I think there’s one guy who can do a better deal and one guy who understands how to get a difficult partner like Iran over the line and that is the president of the United States.

“So I hope that there will be a Trump deal, to be totally honest with you.”

A U.K. government spokesman said the prime minister “supports” the current Iran pact. But they added: “The Iranians aren't currently in compliance and we need to bring them back into compliance. If there's a way to do that we're open to discussing possible solutions.”

Trump welcomed the proposal by Johnson to negotiate a fresh deal, saying he was “not at all surprised that he was the first one to come out and say that.”

“That's why he's a winner,” the president told White House reporters. “That's why he's a man who’s going to be successful in the U.K.”

Trump added that the existing Iran deal was set to too short a timeframe, and that it lacked sufficient inspection rights over Iranian development sites.

On Sunday night, Johnson left the door open to sending troops to Saudi Arabia to help defend its facilities. “We will consider in what way we could be useful if asked — depending on what the exact plan is,” he told journalists on the plane to New York, adding the U.K. would consider any requests for help from Saudi Arabia and the U.S.

Johnson is set to hold talks with Iranian President Hassan Rouhani on Tuesday, on the fringes of the U.N. summit. The meeting will come just hours after face-to-face talks with Trump.
description: Donald Trump welcomed the call for a new Iranian nuclear pact
